Package org.daisy.streamline.engine

Class TempFolderHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.daisy.streamline.engine.TempFolderHandler
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    public class TempFolderHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    This class can be used to limit the code needed to handle temporary files in a folder to folder chain. After each step (folder written to) the temporary folders are reset by calling reset() and you are ready to use the folders again. Note: TempFolderHandler does not work on empty folders. The output folder must contain at least one file when a call to reset() is made.

        Parameters:
        output - an action to perform on the output
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if the input does not exist or if the input or output is a directory or if the temporary folders could not be created.

    • Method Detail

      • getInput

        public java.nio.file.Path getInput()
        Get the current input folder
        Returns:
        Returns the current input folder or null if TempFolderHandler has been closed

      • getOutput

        public java.nio.file.Path getOutput()
        Get the current output folder
        Returns:
        Returns the current output folder or null if TempFolderHandler has been closed

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Resets the input and output folder before writing to the output again
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if TempFolderHandler has been closed or if the output folder is empty.

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Process the result with the output function and then closes the temporary folders. Closing the TempFolderHandler is a mandatory last step after which no other calls to the object should be made.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - An IOException is thrown if the temporary folders have been deleted, or are empty.
